other_tests.findings: Deficient MSH2 expression in the immunohistochemical analysis of a sebaceous carcinoma.
A heterozygous disease-causing mutation in the MSH2 gene was detected; specifically, an insertion mutation 34_35insG was found.
Completely normal findings with no evidence of polyps or malignancy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Malignancy surveillance 2 years later revealed a single polyp with normal mucosal histology and without evidence of microsatellite instability (MSI).
Urinalysis and cystoscopy were repeated 6 months later and findings remained normal.

other_tests.findings: Slightly decreased the number of new and enlarging tumors.
